title: They Said They Weren’t Close to Epstein. New Documents Show Otherwise.
summary: Materials released by the Justice Department revealed that leading business and political figures had enduring relationships with the disgraced financier.

title: Pentagon Defends Restrictions on Media Outlets
summary: The purpose of the new rules is to “stop activity that could compromise national security,” the Defense Department said in response to a New York Times lawsuit.

title: Danes Who Fought Alongside US Troops March Against Trump’s Comments
summary: In the latest anti-American gathering in Denmark, veterans who went to war alongside U.S. troops took to the streets of Copenhagen.

title: Usha Vance’s Pregnancy Becomes a Talking Point
summary: The announcement that the second family is expecting a fourth child has turned Ms. Vance into a symbol of success for proponents of conservative family values.

title: Facing Immigration Backlash, Trump Called Schumer to Cut a Deal
summary: The president and the top Senate Democrat, who are often at each other’s throats, agreed to try to keep the government open and to start talks on new limits on federal immigration agents.

title: Federal Judge Denies Request to Block ICE Surge in Minnesota
summary: Minnesota officials had sought a temporary end to the deployment of 3,000 federal agents, claiming state sovereignty had been violated.

title: Judge Orders Release of 5-Year-Old Detained by Immigration Agents in Minnesota
summary: The image of Liam Conejo Ramos, wearing a blue winter hat and Spider-Man backpack while in the custody of immigration agents, fueled outrage across the country.

title: Bovino Is Said to Have Mocked Prosecutor’s Jewish Faith on Call With Lawyers
summary: Gregory Bovino, the Border Patrol field leader, made disparaging remarks in reference to the U.S. attorney in Minnesota, an Orthodox Jew, people with knowledge of the phone call said.

title: Why Is Taking the Rest of the Donetsk Region So Important to Putin?
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio called the question “the one remaining item” in Abu Dhabi peace talks. Russia disputed that.

title: Republican National Committee Enters 2026 With Nearly $100 Million Edge on D.N.C.
summary: Democrats have struggled to raise money, as is often the case for the party out of power, but the depth of their financial hole against the Republican National Committee is noteworthy.

title: Democratic Upset in Deep Red Texas District Rattles Republicans
summary: A Democrat won a state legislative special election in a district that President Trump carried by 17 percentage points, unnerving Republicans in Texas and beyond.

title: The Richest 2026 Players: A.I., Crypto, Pro-Israel Groups and Trump
summary: All have amassed enormous war chests, new filings show, making them the financial wild cards of this year’s midterm elections and feared political spenders.

title: They’re Stepping Up on ‘The Pitt’
summary: Four actors discuss the evolution of their young clinician characters on “The Pitt.” In Season 2 they are a little older, a little wiser and still soaked in fake blood.

title: My Patient Was Dying. His Wife Would Not Accept It.
summary: How doctors can better navigate difficult patients and families.

title: Syria Must Protect Its Minorities
summary: Without protection for the Kurds and other ethnic minorities, Syria will never be stable.

title: Winter Storm Hits the Carolinas, Bringing Dangerous Ice and Snow
summary: Hundreds of crashes were reported on highways throughout the region, as freezing temperatures were predicted in the overnight hours.

title: 10 Injured in 59-Vehicle Pileup on Fog-Shrouded California Highway, Police Say
summary: One person died earlier this month in a foggy crash on the same highway.

title: ‘Melania’ Arrives With Strong Box Office Showing for a Documentary
summary: Amazon backed up the Brink’s trucks to promote the vanity film, resulting in opening-weekend ticket sales of roughly $8 million, or 60 percent more than expected.
